name: sulfate pulp production, from hardwood, bleached | sulfate pulp, bleached | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17751/documentation

This dataset replaces the dataset "sulfate pulp production, elementary chlorine free bleached, CA-QC, 2012" in ecoinvent version 3.4 and earlier. Sulfate pulp supply chains in different geographies are not structured in the same way, they apply different criteria and levels by which pulping processes are disaggregated. This activity therefore exists in parallel to sulfate pulp supply chains in other geographies. ;It represents the production of elementary chlorine free (ECF) bleached sulfate pulp from the kraft process in Quebec. Data are an average of mills using softwood (3%) and mills using hardwood (97%), As the share of mills using softwood is minor, this activity is modelled as "sulfate pulp production, from hardwood, bleached.

The activity starts at the reception of wood chips from sawmills and pulpwood.

The activity ends with bundled sulfate pulp at 90% water on wet mass basis ready for shipping. 
The dataset includes wood handling, chemical (kraft) pulping and ECF bleaching, drying process, on-site energy production, recovery cycles of chemicals, internal waste water treatment and on-site industrial landfilling.
The dataset doesn't include on-site pick-up truck operation, which uses petrol (negligible).

The data originate partly from a paper mill which produces different types of woodfree papers and kraft pulp. The allocation of most materials and energy inputs between the different coproducts was avoided by subdividing the process of paper making into many subprocesses and collecting data specifically for those subprocesses. However, it was inevitable to make allocation for some general inputs, e.g. diesel burned in on-site vehicles. In those cases, the allocation was done with the dry mass content of the coproducts.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from important pulp mills in the province of Quebec, Canada.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collected from internal reports of the pulp mills.

flow.category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Measured value. Reported as dry mass including bark. A density of 650 kg/m3 and a bark volume fraction of 12% were assumed. The species composing the total hardwood pulpwood input (excluding wood chips) are (mass %):

Hardwoods (97%):
Maple 37%
Beech 7%
Yellow birch 16%
White birch 11%
Aspen 13%
Other hardwoods 13%

Softwoods (3%):
Eastern hemlock 0.6%
Larch 0.45%
Spruce (White) 0.855%
Balsam Fir 1.05%
White and red pine 0.045%

The estimated wood density of hardwoods calculated with the above percentages and generic densities specific to each species is very close to 650 kg/m3 (645 kg/m3), including aspen, which has a low density.
